intro: Oxyspora yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan oxyspora, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested or rocky habitats. Its botanical features include narrow, lance-shaped leaves and a short, sturdy stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
